englishTranslation: You’re not trying to listen to me!
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”

spanishExample: El hombre era muy pobre, por eso yo trataba de hacer algo por él.
englishTranslation: The man was very poor, that’s why I was trying to do something for him.
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
trataba: tried, I tried (Tratar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: El libro se trata de todas esas ideas que nos gustan.
englishTranslation: The book is about all those ideas that we like.
vocabIncluded: gustan: like, they like (Gustar, present, 3rd person plural)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")
trata: tries, he/she/it tries (Tratar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Él siempre lleva eso a la casa.
englishTranslation: He always brings that to the house.
vocabIncluded: lleva: takes, he/she/it takes (Llevar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Ellos la tratan bien y ella ha tratado de ir con ellos.
englishTranslation: They treat her well and she has tried to go with them.
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things
de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
tratan: try, they try (Tratar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Es extraño que no trate de hablar con ella.
englishTranslation: It’s strange that he’s not trying to talk to her.
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
trate: try, he/she/it try (Tratar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Es un lugar bonito y ella trataba de ir todos los días.
englishTranslation: It’s a pretty place and she tried to go every day.
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
trataba: tried, he/she/it tried (Tratar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No es perfecto, siempre toma lo que dejo en la mesa.
englishTranslation: He’s not perfect, he always takes what I leave on the table.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
dejo: stop/leave/allow, I stop/leave/allow (Dejar, present, 1st person)
toma: takes, he/she/it takes (Tomar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quiero que trate de ver la nueva oficina.
englishTranslation: I want him to try to see the new office.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
trate: try, he/she/it try (Tratar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Siempre lo tratamos bien, pero él no nos trató bien ayer.
englishTranslation: We always treat him well, but he didn’t treat us well yesterday.
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things
tratamos: try, we try (Tratar, present, 1st person plural)
trató: tried, he/she/it tried (Tratar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Trata de hablar con ella, por favor. Nosotras ya tratamos de hacerlo.
englishTranslation: Try to talk to her, please. We(f) already tried to do it.
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
tratamos: tried, we tried (Tratar, preterite, 1st person plural)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Trata de ver el baño y la habitación, pero tiene que esperarlos.
englishTranslation: He tries to see the bathroom and the bedroom, but he has to wait for them.
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
trata: tries, he/she/it tries (Tratar, present, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Traté de ser gracioso, pero ya no trataré de hacerlo.
englishTranslation: I tried to be funny(m), but I won’t try to do it anymore.
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
trataré: will try , I will try (Tratar, future, 1st person)
traté: tried, I tried (Tratar, preterite, 1st person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Trato de hacerlo solo cuando tú tratas de hacerlo.
englishTranslation: I try to do it only when you try to do it.
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
tratas: try, you try (Tratar, present, 2nd person)
trato: try, I try (Tratar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Vamos a tratar de pasar por ese edificio.
englishTranslation: We’re going to try to pass by that building.
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
